message.entry: Input file must be an EXR file.
Unable to read file ''{0}''. The OpenEXR library failed with the following error: \n''{1}''.
Unable to write file ''{0}''. The OpenEXR library failed with the following error: \n''{1}''.
''{0}'' attribute value must be a string scalar or character vector.
Invalid data type. ''{0}'' attribute value must be a double scalar.
Invalid value type ''{0}'' specified for attribute ''{1}''.
The attribute ''{0}'' is not supported for writing. See documentation for a list of supported attributes.
''EnvironmentMap'' attribute value must be ''LatLon'' or ''Cube''
''Chromaticities'' attribute value must be a scalar structure.
Missing or invalid fields. ''Chromaticities'' attribute value must be a scalar structure that contains the fields ''Red'', ''Green'', ''Blue'' and ''White''.
''{0}'' value must be a 2-element row vector of data type double.
''{0}'' attribute value must be a {1, number, integer}-by-{2, number, integer} numeric matrix.
''Alpha'' value must be the same size as the first two dimensions of the image data.
''DataWindow'' value must specify start and end values corresponding to a window the same size as the image data.
''TileDimensions'' value must specify tile dimensions smaller than the dimensions of the image data.
''PartIdentifier'' value must be less than or equal to the number of parts in the file, {0,number,integer}.
Unable to find the specified ''PartIdentifier'' value,''{0}'', in the input file.
Multiple parts in the input file have the name ''{0}''. Specify ''PartIdentifier'' using the numeric index of the desired part in the structure returned by exrinfo.
Unable to find one or more names specified by ''Channels'' in part {0, number, integer} of the input file.
When ''Channels'' value is a cell array, each cell must contain a character vector.
''Channels'' value must specify image data channels that are of the same data type.
''Channels'' value must specify image data channels that have the same subsampling rate along the X- and Y-directions.
Part {0, number, integer} of the input file does not contain a valid RGB, YUV, or grayscale image.
Automatic conversion from YUV to RGB is not supported when reading from parts other than part 0. Read the Y, RY and BY channels individually and perform the conversion manually.
''Alpha'' name-value argument is not supported when ''Channels'' value specifies an ''A'' channel.
To write multiresolution image data, the size of the highest resolution data must be an integer multiple of the size of subsampled data.
File name must be nonempty.
File name must have file extension ''.exr''.
Invalid number of channels in image data. To write images other than Grayscale or RGB, specify the ''Channels'' name-value argument.
''Channels'' value must specify nonempty channel names.
''Channels'' value must specify unique channel names.
''Channels'' value must specify the same number of channels as the image data.
Number of channels specified by ''Channels'' and ''OutputType'' must match.
When the image data is a numeric array, the ''OutputType'' value must be the same for all channels.
When the image data is a cell array, each cell must contain a nonempty 2-D numeric matrix.
Data type half is not supported. Use exrHalfAsSingle to store half precision values as data type single before writing.
Invalid ''{0}'' value in the {1}-direction. Start value must be less than the end value.
Unable to append to specified file because one or more existing parts are invalid or not supported.

Unable to append to specified file because ''DisplayWindow'' must be the same for all parts. Specify an image data array the same size as the existing parts or use the ''DisplayWindow'' name-value argument to set the display window size.
